name: SeaDataNet MedAtlas format
description: The MEDATLAS format is an autodescriptive ASCII format. it has been designed to describe vertical profiles (reference parameter = Pressure or Depth), timeseries (reference parameter= Date/Time) and trajectories (reference parameter = Localisation and Date/Time). It has been designed in 1994, in conformity with the international ICES/IOC GETADE recommendations.  The format has been upgraded in the frame of the SeadataNet projects (from 2006)  to be interoperable with the SeaDataNet infrastructure.  Profiles measured with the same instrument (bottles, CTD, XBT, ...) during the same cruise, are grouped within the same file which includes: 1) a 'cruise header' based on the international CSR information; 2) a 'station header' including the cruise reference, the originator station reference within the cruise and the time and location; 3) the 'data' for the profile.  The sequence 'profile header'/'data points' is repeated for each profile.

additionalProperty.name: Bibliographic citation
additionalProperty.value: Lowry Roy, Fichaut Michele, Schlitzer Reiner, Maudire Gilbert, Bregent Sophie (2019). SeaDataNet. Datafile formats. ODV, MEDATLAS, NETCDF. DELIVERABLE D8.5. https://doi.org/10.13155/56547
